equatiomatic 0.0.0.9000

LaTeX code for R models

extract_eq.Rd

Extract the variable names from a model to produce a LaTeX equation, which is output to the screen. Supports any model supported by [broom::tidy][broom::tidy].

extract_eq(model, preview = FALSE, ital_vars = FALSE, wrap = FALSE,
  width = 120, align_env = "aligned", use_coefs = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

model

A fitted model
preview

Logical, defaults to FALSE. Should the equation be previewed in the viewer pane?
ital_vars

Logical, defaults to FALSE. Should the variable names not be wrapped in the \text{} command?
wrap

Logical, defaults to FALSE. Should the equation be inserted in a special aligned TeX environment and automatically wrapped to a specific width?
width

Integer, defaults to 120. The suggested number of characters per line in the wrapped equation. Used only when aligned is TRUE.
align_env

TeX environment to wrap around equation. Must be one of aligned, aligned*, align, or align*. Defaults to aligned.
use_coefs

Logical, defaults to FALSE. Should the actual model estimates be included in the equation instead of math symbols?
…

arguments passed to [texPreview::tex_preview][texPreview::tex_preview]

Examples

# Simple model
mod1 <- lm(mpg ~ cyl + disp, mtcars)
extract_eq(mod1)
#> $$
#>  \text{mpg} = \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{cyl}) + \beta_{2} (\text{disp}) + \epsilon 
#> $$

# Include all variables
mod2 <- lm(mpg ~ ., mtcars)
extract_eq(mod2)
#> $$
#>  \text{mpg} = \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{cyl}) + \beta_{2} (\text{disp}) + \beta_{3} (\text{hp}) + \beta_{4} (\text{drat}) + \beta_{5} (\text{wt}) + \beta_{6} (\text{qsec}) + \beta_{7} (\text{vs}) + \beta_{8} (\text{am}) + \beta_{9} (\text{gear}) + \beta_{10} (\text{carb}) + \epsilon 
#> $$

# Works for categorical variables too, putting levels as subscripts
mod3 <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Sepal.Width + Species, iris)
extract_eq(mod3)
#> $$
#>  \text{Sepal.Length} = \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{Sepal.Width}) + \beta_{2} (\text{Species}_{\text{versicolor}}) + \beta_{3} (\text{Species}_{\text{virginica}}) + \epsilon 
#> $$

set.seed(8675309)
d <- data.frame(cat1 = rep(letters[1:3], 100),
                cat2 = rep(LETTERS[1:3], each = 100),
                cont1 = rnorm(300, 100, 1),
                cont2 = rnorm(300, 50, 5),
                out   = rnorm(300, 10, 0.5))
mod4 <- lm(out ~ ., d)
extract_eq(mod4)
#> $$
#>  \text{out} = \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{cat1}_{\text{b}}) + \beta_{2} (\text{cat1}_{\text{c}}) + \beta_{3} (\text{cat2}_{\text{B}}) + \beta_{4} (\text{cat2}_{\text{C}}) + \beta_{5} (\text{cont1}) + \beta_{6} (\text{cont2}) + \epsilon 
#> $$

# Preview the equation
extract_eq(mod4, preview = TRUE)
#> $$
#>  \text{out} = \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{cat1}_{\text{b}}) + \beta_{2} (\text{cat1}_{\text{c}}) + \beta_{3} (\text{cat2}_{\text{B}}) + \beta_{4} (\text{cat2}_{\text{C}}) + \beta_{5} (\text{cont1}) + \beta_{6} (\text{cont2}) + \epsilon 
#> $$

# Don't italicize terms
extract_eq(mod1, ital_vars = FALSE)
#> $$
#>  \text{mpg} = \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{cyl}) + \beta_{2} (\text{disp}) + \epsilon 
#> $$

# Wrap equations in an "aligned" environment
extract_eq(mod2, wrap = TRUE)
#> $$
#> \begin{aligned}
#> \text{mpg} =& \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{cyl}) + \beta_{2} (\text{disp}) + \beta_{3} (\text{hp}) + \beta_{4} \\
#> & (\text{drat}) + \beta_{5} (\text{wt}) + \beta_{6} (\text{qsec}) + \beta_{7} (\text{vs}) + \beta_{8} (\text{am}) + \\
#> & \beta_{9} (\text{gear}) + \beta_{10} (\text{carb}) + \epsilon
#> \end{aligned}
#> $$

# Wider equation wrapping
extract_eq(mod2, wrap = TRUE, width = 150)
#> $$
#> \begin{aligned}
#> \text{mpg} =& \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{cyl}) + \beta_{2} (\text{disp}) + \beta_{3} (\text{hp}) + \beta_{4} (\text{drat}) + \beta_{5} (\text{wt}) + \\
#> & \beta_{6} (\text{qsec}) + \beta_{7} (\text{vs}) + \beta_{8} (\text{am}) + \beta_{9} (\text{gear}) + \beta_{10} (\text{carb}) + \epsilon
#> \end{aligned}
#> $$

# Include model estimates instead of Greek letters
extract_eq(mod2, wrap = TRUE, use_coefs = TRUE)
#> $$
#> \begin{aligned}
#> \text{mpg} =& 12.3 + -0.11 (\text{cyl}) + 0.01 (\text{disp}) + -0.02 (\text{hp}) + 0.79 (\text{drat}) + -3.72 \\
#> & (\text{wt}) + 0.82 (\text{qsec}) + 0.32 (\text{vs}) + 2.52 (\text{am}) + 0.66 (\text{gear}) + -0.2 (\text{carb}) + \\
#> & \epsilon
#> \end{aligned}
#> $$

# Use other model types, like glm
set.seed(8675309)
d <- data.frame(out = sample(0:1, 100, replace = TRUE),
                cat1 = rep(letters[1:3], 100),
                cat2 = rep(LETTERS[1:3], each = 100),
                cont1 = rnorm(300, 100, 1),
                cont2 = rnorm(300, 50, 5))
mod5 <- glm(out ~ ., data = d, family = binomial(link = "logit"))
extract_eq(mod5, wrap = TRUE)
#> $$
#> \begin{aligned}
#> \text{out} =& \alpha + \beta_{1} (\text{cat1}_{\text{b}}) + \beta_{2} (\text{cat1}_{\text{c}}) + \beta_{3} \\
#> & (\text{cat2}_{\text{B}}) + \beta_{4} (\text{cat2}_{\text{C}}) + \beta_{5} (\text{cont1}) + \beta_{6} (\text{cont2}) + \\
#> & \epsilon
#> \end{aligned}
#> $$
